channel.title: Comments on: Finding Time for One Game a Day

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I've noticed that you haven't been on very much! I imagine school is keeping you pretty busy? =)
item.content:encoded: I’ve noticed that you haven’t been on very much! I imagine school is keeping you pretty busy? =)

item.title: By: Moboy78
item.dc:creator: Moboy78
item.description: I remember doing this same thing last year, and with pretty good success if I do say so myself. Though I no longer have the time to do it, I think that you're right about one game a day being beneficial for all players. At the moment, though, I just want to be able to find the time to play one game before September is over =).
item.content:encoded: I remember doing this same thing last year, and with pretty good success if I do say so myself. Though I no longer have the time to do it, I think that you’re right about one game a day being beneficial for all players. At the moment, though, I just want to be able to find the time to play one game before September is over =).

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: That's awesome! So glad to hear that other people are doing it too. Haha. I personally prefer long games as well, but time is just not on my side lately. xD I'm looking forward to seeing your games when you are ready to play on your main account again!
item.content:encoded: That’s awesome! So glad to hear that other people are doing it too. Haha. I personally prefer long games as well, but time is just not on my side lately. xD I’m looking forward to seeing your games when you are ready to play on your main account again!

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Nice! I figured that there was no way the only time you played go was during workshop and the occasional game with me. =P I would say that studying is only as good as the application. Granted, some players get by with studying and no playing; but I find that they are the minority. Especially since those kind of prodigies are generally insei anyways. =D But I would say it wouldn't hurt to add tsumego to your "study regimen" if you wanted to feel like you were balancing it a bit more. =)
item.content:encoded:
Nice! I figured that there was no way the only time you played go was during workshop and the occasional game with me. =P I would say that studying is only as good as the application. Granted, some players get by with studying and no playing; but I find that they are the minority. Especially since those kind of prodigies are generally insei anyways. =D
But I would say it wouldn’t hurt to add tsumego to your “study regimen” if you wanted to feel like you were balancing it a bit more. =)

item.title: By: hilbert90
item.dc:creator: hilbert90
item.description: I've also been playing on a secret KGS account. I'll switch back soon, but I really wanted to weed out some of the more obvious embarrassing moves that have been happening from lack of playing. I have been successful in a game a day since that first post. I use all time settings except blitz. I hope for a long game, but don't mind the practice at thinking quickly if a 10 minute one comes up.
item.content:encoded:
I’ve also been playing on a secret KGS account. I’ll switch back soon, but I really wanted to weed out some of the more obvious embarrassing moves that have been happening from lack of playing. I have been successful in a game a day since that first post.
I use all time settings except blitz. I hope for a long game, but don’t mind the practice at thinking quickly if a 10 minute one comes up.

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: Yeah, I've been wondering whether I should just accept that my secret account for irresponsible blitzing might be responsible for my continued progress. It's at 4k, a solid notch below the 3k I can maintain with my playing carefully account, but I probably play at least six quick games a week, sometimes more, which means I've gotten a lot more games in than I otherwise would have. Anyway, I don't know. It's so hard for me to say whether I think it's good or bad. I guess it's probably better than doing nothing related to go. But is it better than spending the corresponding amount of time studying? I don't know.
item.content:encoded: Yeah, I’ve been wondering whether I should just accept that my secret account for irresponsible blitzing might be responsible for my continued progress. It’s at 4k, a solid notch below the 3k I can maintain with my playing carefully account, but I probably play at least six quick games a week, sometimes more, which means I’ve gotten a lot more games in than I otherwise would have. Anyway, I don’t know. It’s so hard for me to say whether I think it’s good or bad. I guess it’s probably better than doing nothing related to go. But is it better than spending the corresponding amount of time studying? I don’t know.
